DAKAR ( Thomson Reuters Foundation ) - There were no windows at Camp Martyr , the Chadian prison where dictator Hissene Habre locked up dissenters .
Just eight dark cells , reeking of sweat and urine , where hundreds of men were crammed together , awaiting torture and execution .
Others had tubes shoved down their throats and their stomachs pumped full of water , said Abdourahmane Gueye , a former prisoner who had been accused of being a spy .
